main event: A star-like yellow object was observed in the sky over St. Louis, Missouri on 27 October 1957 for one minute. It was silver-dollar in size and was sighted under clear and dark conditions.
interesting points: The object was described as star-like and yellow, with a silver-dollar size.
Observation lasted for one minute with clear and dark weather conditions.
The report mentions a reference to an air traffic control radar report confirming the object's description, duration, flight path, and altitude.
The conclusion of the report suggests that the object was probably an aircraft.
The report contains handwritten notes and various text entries, possibly indicating additional investigations or information.
witnesses: Civilian and assistant to Dr. Gordon at Washington University
